alert.note: Alert for Arapahoe; Elbert (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 11:28AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central and northeast Colorado, including the following counties, in east central Colorado, Elbert. In northeast Colorado, Arapahoe. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1126 AM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream and ditch flooding. Expect standing water in fields. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen over the last three hours. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eastern Aurora, Elbert, Bennett, Elizabeth, Kiowa, Simla, Deer Trail, Agate, Matheson, Byers, Strasburg, Ponderosa Park, Kutch, Fondis and Cedar Point.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
